snippet: In “The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History,” the New Yorker writer Elizabeth Kolbert asks science-based questions about whether humans might be causing mass extinction.
abstract: Interview with environmental journalist Elizabeth Kolbert in which she discusses her book The Sixth Extinction: Extinction: An Unnatural History, which asks science-based questions about whether humans, only partly through global warming, might be causing mass extinction on planet.
lead_paragraph: In “The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History,” the New Yorker writer Elizabeth Kolbert asks science-based questions about whether humans might be causing mass extinction.

headline.print_headline: Chasing the Biggest Story on Earth
headline.seo: ‘The Sixth Extinction’ Looks at Human Impact on the Environment
headline.main: Chasing the Biggest Story on Earth
